intro: Stachytarpheta mutabilis var. violacea, commonly known as violet verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers that bloom in dense, spike-like clusters. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Its rapid growth and showy blooms make it a valuable addition to tropical and subtropical landscapes.
